DOC.brief_summary: Background - Recently publish study confirm preheat femoral component enhances shear strength implant-cement interface . Both Iesaka et al 2003 Jafri et al 2004 show reduction cement porosity cement-implant interface preheat femur component . We use radiostereometry analysis ( RSA ) investigate preheat femur component influence prosthesis survivorship . There clinical control study perform date . The aim study - Comparison migration rate preheat non-preheated femur component , analyze RSA . Methods - Randomization 80 patient 2 group 40 . All patient undergo standard hybrid total hip replacement . In group one femur component ( Bi-Metric , Interlock Biomet ) preheat 40 degree Celsius cementation . In group two : control group , femur component room temperature . We measure temperature cement bone interface operation use thermocouple electrode insert separate drill hole femur . The measurement record every 10 second . The patient follow standard postoperative rehabilitation program . - The RSA analysis perform first day operation 3 , 12 , 24 month postoperatively . - The Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry scanning ( DEXA ) femur perform first week operation 12 24 month postoperatively . - The patient follow clinically radiologically 1 2 year operation ( Harris Hip Score ) . - The result express mean + SD ( mm ) . ANOVA statistical analysis use confirm difference group .
